P: L' ordre du jour appelle la déclaration de la Commission sur la gouvernance mondiale , à la suite du Forum social mondial de Porto Alegre et du Forum économique mondial de New  ⁇ ork .
P: Mr President , thank you very much for urging the Commission to present its thoughts on the events of Porto Alegre and New  ⁇ ork .
P: I think this is a good opportunity to also present the initiatives that the Commission has adopted over the last few weeks on these issues .
P: As you know , the International Conference on the Finance of Monterrey is to take place very shortly , the World Summit on the Sustainable Development of Johannesburg will take place in September and we need to define our position on these two subjects .
P: A great deal has been spoken about the antagonism that exists between the World Social Forum in Porto Alegre and the World Economic Forum in New  ⁇ ork .
P: In both cases , representatives of different - cultural and ideological origins - and from different environments have come together .
P: The World Economic Forum certainly has , and adequately speaking , been used as a springboard for a wide , well-based and unparalleled debate on problems of concern throughout the world and urgently need a solution .
P: However , some observers claim that the Porto Alegre meeting was of greater importance than that in New  ⁇ ork .
P: They are making sure that world civil society was represented in Brazil and not in New  ⁇ ork .
P: Personally , I was not denying the participants of the World Economic Forum on the right to development to be seen as an integral part of civil society .
P: Nevertheless , it is certain that the Social Forum was an important meeting , which is an essential event in which politicians will have to be clearly taken into account .
P: Now , my conclusion is that the participants in the World Social Forum in Porto Alegre do not all adopt a purely anti-globalist attitude .
P: Rather , I think that they are even part of this phenomenon of globalisation , which , thanks to new technologies , has allowed non-governmental movements to impact on a global scale .
P: Criticising a capitalist model that can lead to the weakening of social cohesion and the exhaustion of natural resources is something else .
P: In this regard , optical values and concerns in Davos and Porto Alegre may not be so far removed from each other .
P: A balance between the economic and social process and the preservation of our planet 's resources is an important responsibility and a arduous task that no one nor any country can take on their own .
P: The solutions to achieve this are difficult and complex .
P: There are easy solutions and they are sometimes popular , but they tend to pass in silence over the secondary effects and choices and renounce painful very often involved in the policies adopted .
P: Having said that , the complexity of the real solutions often results in a lack of understanding on the part of the social movements and even politicians .
P: That is why we believe it is essential to carry out studies in depth , which will make it possible to clarify things , to explain and to communicate the information in a clear manner .
P: The Commission has tried to do this through its report ' The answers to the challenges of globalisation ' .
P: We reject any kind of prejudice and the study includes a series of proposals for reforming the international financial architecture , as they occur in the current academic and political debate , and it sets this series of proposals in the context of which we find ourselves .
P: Whilst acknowledging that globalisation has many other aspects , not least a social and ecological aspect , the report is central to the international financial and monetary system and the problems of financing development .
P: In order to draw up this report , we began by analysing the development of the globalisation process in the economic field and by establishing a number of challenges linked to the financial and monetary system .
P: The report acknowledges the benefits of international economic integration , but it also highlights the existence of systemic deficiencies and the persistence of an important problem : the reduction of poverty .
P: It confirms the need for formal development aid that is more important and efficient .
P: This report states have succeeded in raising their income per capita and in improving their quality of life to an extent that they would not have achieved less integration strategy .
P: It also takes into account the significant increase in foreign direct investment , a fundamental factor in strengthening growth and thus combating poverty .
P: The report examines several existing proposals on international taxes .
P: With regard to the general use of these taxes as a potential source of funding for development or public goods , we have reached the conclusion that , although some of them seem attractive to short- and medium-term needs , there is not much alternatives to funding from national budget resources .
P: This conclusion involves an adjustment of priorities in the financial assets .
P: Another interesting proposal is the introduction of the tax on monetary transactions .
P: The report considers two perspectives : firstly , with regard to the so-called ' Tobin tax ' or ' Tobin tax ' as a tool for stabilising the currency markets , the analysis leads us to the fact that it is difficult to assume that this tax will essentially contribute to stabilising exchange rates .
P: However , if we look at this instrument as a tool to increase the resources available for the financing of development , the Tobin tax can be more attractive .
P: It is certain that its application would prove hard , as it would have to recover almost everyone in the world in order to minimise tax evasion and would require a strong international consensus .
P: Even in the event that such a consensus could be reached at a political level , there would still be many technical problems , including problems related to an appropriate tax base and recovery mechanisms .
P: These results coincide in essence with the resolution on the international monetary system approved by the European Parliament last autumn .
P: Another important aspect of the report is the observation that technical assistance and capacity building are important for a large number of developing countries if they are to be able to take advantage of the opportunities for growth resulting from trade .
P: Ladies and gentlemen , the European Union is well placed to take on a leading role in promoting sustainable development globally .
P: It occupies the world 's first place in development aid , it is the world 's largest trading partner and is an important source of foreign direct investment .
P: On the other hand , in its commitment to protecting the environment , it is developing and promoting the use and dissemination of environmentally friendly technologies both within and outside Europe .
P: The European integration model was developed in accordance with mutual support strategies for stable economic growth , social development and environmental protection .
P: Based on these successes and not forgetting the forthcoming World Summit on the Sustainable Development of Johannesburg , the Commission has drafted the communication for a partnership for sustainable development .
P: Its intention is to outline the strategic elements that are used as a basis for a comprehensive agreement at Johannesburg with a view to achieving that all the partners , both north and south , are working together for sustainable development .
P: The communication highlights several key priorities and includes concrete action proposals in economic , social and ecological areas .
P: Within the framework of the WTO , the Commission and the Member States have made a commitment to conducting negotiations in a constructive manner in order to continue the process of establishing a fair and market economy system , in line with the conclusions of the Doha Ministerial Conference .
P: Our objective is to improve the global standard of living through the liberalisation and development of trade in a comprehensive way .
P: The Community is actively promoting developing countries and , in particular , the least developed nations to participate in the international trade system .
P: The ' Everything but Arms ' initiative is an important step in this direction , but it is not sufficient and we call on everyone to follow our example and facilitate access to the market for the least developed countries .
P: We are also taking steps to support the efforts made by developing countries to integrate into the global trade system and to profit from it .
P: In accordance with the Doha development programme , we have also recommended that Member States increase their aid for trade .
P: The European Union also contributes to international efforts to strengthen the resistance of the international financial and monetary system and to reduce the risk of abuse in the financing of terrorism , money laundering and other illegal financial activities .
P: The Union will continue to focus its development policy on the crucial objective of reducing poverty .
P: It will therefore provide resources accordingly and ensure that European aid is employed effectively .
P: It would be possible to achieve real practical progress in the area of quality and efficiency if the rules governing the policies and methods to be used were more harmonised , both at Community and in the Member States .
P: Nevertheless , let us not forget the need to increase efficiency , the Commission believes that there is an imbalance between the resources needed for achieving the objectives of the new Millennium Development Goals and the deadlines set and the means at present available .
P: For this reason , in anticipation of the success of the conference on the Development of Monterrey , the Commission recommended that the Council increase the volume of official development aid , and we would suggest that by 2006 , all countries whose percentage of aid in relation to national income falls below the average of the European Union , namely 0.33 % , reach this level .
P: If we achieve this target , the Union average would increase and would be almost 0.4 % , which would become a new threshold for the Member States of the Union which , by means of this increase , could make a significant contribution to the realisation of the new Millennium Development Goals .
P: On the other hand , a strong commitment accompanied by this gradual development would consolidate the Union 's position in the negotiations on an international fruitful distribution of burdens .
P: Finally , with regard to global environmental protection , the Commission is proposing to launch an initiative on sustainable water management .
P: We have committed ourselves to putting pressure on our partners to achieve a recomposition of as much as 50 % of the Global Environment Fund before the month of April 2002 and with the aim of extending its scope .
P: We encourage the application of multilateral environmental agreements , such as the ratification of the Kyoto Protocol , something that the Member States have already made at the beginning of this month .
P: In general terms , I do not believe that , as industrialised nations , we have the right to demand from developing countries that they make greater efforts to protect the planet if we are not prepared to fulfil our commitments .
P: Ladies and gentlemen , building a sustainable future for the world requires all to cooperate .
P: However , real progress can only be achieved if the main partners commit themselves to playing an essential role and , in this regard , I am convinced that the European Union must and can play this fundamental role .
P: Mr President , in the world , one in five people is deprived of access to clean drinking water , education and basic health care .

P: We are now seeking an alternative , not as a project , but as a knowledge of thought and work enabling our ideals of social and security equality for all to take shape .

P: But free trade must then be accompanied by rules and checks - through regional competition authorities - to prevent too strong power concentrations .
P: These rules must serve to protect and support the poorer regions and contribute to a radical opening up of the markets to the developing countries .
P: It is also a matter of preventing the highest possible protection through a set of measures for the social monitoring of transnational companies , although these might be welcome .
P: It is also a matter of preventing unilateral trade from transnational companies or major economic powers such as the United States and of preventing the exclusive concentration on a new arms race , to the detriment of public areas such as education and healthcare .

P: J' appelle la question no 40 de M. Glyn Ford ( H-0092 / 02 ) :
P: Objet : Directive-cadre sur l' eau
P: d' ici 2015 , dans le cadre de la nouvelle directive-cadre sur l' eau 2000 / 60 / CE
P: La directive-cadre sur l' eau a fixé l' objectif d' atteindre un bon statut pour toutes les eaux de l' Union européenne .
P: Elle abordera toutes les sources de pollution pertinentes , y compris les activités industrielles .
P: En tant qu' outil permettant d' atteindre cet objectif , la directive suit une approche combinée des contrôles d' émissions qui s' attaquent à la pollution à la source et aux normes de qualité de l' eau à atteindre pour le corps maritime en particulier .
P: La directive-cadre sur les principales sources de pollution , les rejets d' eaux urbaines , la pollution provoquée par l' agriculture et les impacts des grandes installations industrielles prévoit des contrôles d' émission pour les substances particulièrement dangereuses et les normes de qualité de l' eau au niveau communautaire .

P: Ce résultat sera atteint par une participation publique obligatoire lors de l' élaboration et de l' adoption des plans de gestion du bassin de rivière nécessaires , mais aussi par un large processus participative au niveau de l' UE , en facilitant la mise en œuvre de la directive .

P: Mr President , Commissioner Ferrero-Waldner , ladies and gentlemen , from the very outset , the European Union has welcomed the creation of the United Nations Human Rights Council in 2006 , but has always emphasised that it expects the Council to be an effective and credible body , which makes a real contribution to protecting human rights internationally .
P: In previous sittings of the Human Rights Council , the European Union has also attached importance to fundamental debates on human rights issues , as well as dialogue and close cooperation .
P: During the fourth regular session , the European Union and the African group were able to ensure that their resolution on Darfur was adopted by consensus .
P: This resolution was the result of efforts supported by the European Union , and this result reflects not only the Council 's mission , but also the level of responsibility that it is supposed to exercise .
P: The ability of the Human Rights Council to fulfil its role is inextricably linked to its composition .
P: I would like to remind you once again that the United Nations General Assembly is waiting for the Member States of the Council to respect the highest standards of human rights .
P: It also invited all the members of the United Nations to elect the Council only of the nations with good results in the area of human rights .
P: Although this ideal is still far from being achieved , I would like to express the European Union 's satisfaction of seeing Belarus 's election in the Human Rights Council successfully prevented in May .
P: This success was largely due to the opposition of the European Union to Belarus 's candidacy .
P: Even though it is a minority minority in many people , the European Union plays a leading role in the Council , and it has now been established as a major player .
P: Despite some encouraging developments , such as the adoption of an international convention for the protection of all people against forced disappearances , more action is needed to provide the Human Rights Council with the practices and the working instruments needed to meet the expectations of the international community , especially those of the European Union .
P: The European Union is given absolute priority to the Council 's institutional establishment .
P: It is therefore making strenuous efforts to ensure that this process for building an institution is successfully concluded before the end of the first year .
P: The fifth session , which will be held impending , will therefore take crucial importance .
P: During this sitting , the Council will make its final decisions on the establishment of the institution and will determine by then its own efficiency and credibility for the next five years .
P: At present , the European Union is working closely , in Geneva , with all participants in order to achieve a result that will enable the Human Rights Council to perform its role fully .
P: In the contacts of the Presidency of the Union with the President and other delegations of the Human Rights Council , we are trying to establish within the United Nations system an efficient and credible Council with a central role .
P: To this end , the European Union wishes to emphasise the creation of an effective and universal periodical review and the preservation of missions specific to certain subjects or countries .
P: The Code of Conduct planned for Special rapporteurs must not compromise their independence ; on the contrary , it must guarantee independence and concentration of states ' obligations with which the rapporteur cooperates .
P: Furthermore , we continue with the aim of setting up an appropriate selection procedure for national representatives , which will ensure that they have the necessary skills and ensure their independence .
P: We are aware of the difficulties involved in pursuing these objectives .
P: Let me assure you that we will not relax our efforts to achieve this .
P: On the other hand , the European Union always has a good hope that the Human Rights Council , with its regular session sessions throughout the year , its new improved set of instruments and its continuing commitment to dialogue with special rapporteurs and High Commissioner for Human Rights , will gradually become a cornerstone of the UN human rights system .
P: It is now up to all members of the Human Rights Council to act responsibly and to work towards achieving these objectives .
P: Mr President , Mr President-in-Office of the Council , ladies and gentlemen , since its foundation , the European Union , as you know , has been one of the main forces driving forces behind the protection of human rights , and has therefore played an active role in pursuing the objectives of the Human Rights Council and ensuring that this new body is a real improvement in relation to the Human Rights Commission .
P: The initial aims were therefore to ensure that the Council sittings deal with urgent issues concerning human rights , in the context of specific cases , improving coordination within the European Union , and increasing efforts to raise the so-called ' governments ' , in other words , in relation to external rights issues of the European Union .
P: Referable progress has been made in this regard , enabling us , on the one hand , to have a coherent and credible attitude in the Human Rights Council and , on the other hand , to strengthen our cooperation with partners in other parts of the world , bilateral meetings and within the framework of multilateral forums , and through a broad awareness campaign in the many capitals of the world .
P: The priority tasks of the first year are therefore the preservation of the human rights Council 's missions and mechanisms within the framework of the review process and the establishment of the new system , known as universal periodic review , for monitoring of the human rights situation in all countries .
P: The general compromise package presented yesterday by the President-in-Office of the Council of Human Rights certainly moves in the right direction ; although it still needs to be improved , it nevertheless constitutes a very good basis from our point of view for negotiations .
P: The fifth session of the Human Rights Council , to be held next week , therefore , is of particular importance as the key to the future of this body .
P: That is another reason why I am particularly pleased that a delegation from the European Parliament is present at the session of the European Communities ' delegation .
P: What is the verdict on the performance of the Human Rights Council to date ?
P: It is impossible to give a clear and clear answer , but in my opinion the Council should be a project in preparation , a kind of work that has never been completed , in some way .
P: Let me make a few brief comments .
P: The first sittings of the Council were certainly rather disappointing .
P: The old behaviour schemes would overtaken the surface .
P: Of course , we were already familiar with these schemes , since the Human Rights Commission .
P: The sittings on the Middle East , in particular , were truly wasted by the non-cooperative attitude of the same states that had convened them .
P: The result of this has been unbalanced motion for a resolution which the European Union has not been able to support .
P: So let me make it quite clear that if the confrontation on human rights issues may be necessary on the occasion , when fundamental rights of the people are at stake , this is another matter if human rights are to be used as cover for the continuation of a conflict above all else .
P: Like the Presidency of the Council , however , we have also noted that the very good resolution on Darfur , which was recently adopted , has minimised these negative impressions .
P: I firmly believe that this is the most important resolution that the Council has adopted .
P: It has been coordinated closely with the African group , in very protracted negotiations , and has finally been adopted by consensus .
P: This was an outstanding result when we consider how sensitive the issue was , and the fact that the European Union can now be able to be fighting easily in the votes in the Human Rights Council .
P: The United Nations supervisory body , which was set up in the resolution , will present its first report to the Council over the next few weeks , very probably next week .
P: Let us not forget that the International Court of Justice has recently made two Sudanese suspects .
P: In short , there are at least developments on this front in Darfur .
P: We very much hope that this will be an example , but also lay down standards for future work of the Human Rights Council .
P: Lately , interactive dialogues with the High Commissioner and the United Nations Special rapporteur have proved to be a very useful development .
P: They have allowed us to approach the human rights situation in some countries - often in relation to more general human rights issues - in a very visible manner , but also in a great deal less confrontation .
P: However , our next approach will be to find ways of ensuring that these dialogues can be followed by practical progress on the ground .
P: As we look forward to the rapid progress of the United Nations Human Rights Council , I would like to warn everyone of the scudgeous judgments at this stage about the Council .
P: All we can say at the moment is that there have been clear and unclear aspects .
P: We are convinced that the European Union will continue its efforts to take advantage of the encouraging developments that have undoubtedly occurred and fuel , within the framework of intensive dialogue with its partners in the United Nations , an effective United Nations Human Rights Council and , above all , a Council which is in the interests of the people concerned .
P: This remains the main international forum for the treatment of human rights , and we in the European Union have the responsibility for making an active use of them to consolidate our values , our ideals and our interests .

P: au nom du groupe ITS . - ( RO ) Monsieur le Président , nous ne pouvons que nous féliciter d' une analyse de l' évolution du marché unique - cet objectif majeur du projet européen - 50 ans après ses débuts .
P: Cependant , il n' est pas certain que des progrès significatifs aient été accomplis ; le projet est sérieusement retardé par rapport au calendrier proposé .
P: La situation est regrettable vu que cet important instrument de solidarité inclut les quatre libertés fondamentales ( libre circulation des personnes , des biens , des capitales et des services ) ne contribue pas de manière cohérente à la réalisation du projet européen .
P: Sans aborder la question de la construction du marché unique très analytique , je voudrais dire que la réalisation de cet objectif sera confrontée à des difficultés en raison d' au moins trois raisons .
P: L' écart existant entre les différents niveaux de fonctionnalité et l' efficacité des marchés nationaux : théorique , toutes les économies fondées sur des relations de marché libres sont fonctionnelles ; pratiquement parlant , la fonctionnalité du marché est conditionée par une série de facteurs politiques , économiques , sociaux , culturels et , surtout , historiques qui donnent le caractère d' un marché plus ou moins fonctionnel ; cet écart n' a d' effets défavorables sur la construction du marché unique .
P: Les mesures protectionnistes mises en place par certains États , notamment ceux qui disposent d' une économie développée , ne permettent pas aux marchés moins développés d' avancer et cet abus de pouvoir économique réduit de manière significative leurs droits aux bénéfices des effets de la concurrence , qui est un élément essentiel du marché unique .
P: Enfin , l' absence de dispositions juridiques communes , en particulier dans le domaine de la fiscalité , a des effets négatifs sur le projet de marché unique , en gardant à l' esprit que l' hétérogénéité dans la fiscalité pourrait provoquer des tensions entre les États membres .
P: Je soutiens le rapport , mais je pense que pour assurer une plus grande cohérence , une analyse aurait dû être réalisée des marchés nationaux dans les États membres dont les économies sont moins développées , notamment dans les nouveaux États membres , comme la Roumanie et , à la suite des résultats , il faut mettre en place des mesures de rapprochement avec les économies développées , car il s' agit là d' une condition sine qua non pour la construction du marché unique européen .
P: ( CS ) Mesdames et Messieurs , le marché commun est sans nul doute la pierre angulaire de la compétitivité de l' Union européenne et de la satisfaction des consommateurs .
P: Le rapport dont nous débattons aujourd' hui montre clairement , et à mon avis à juste titre , que ce marché , dont nous pouvons être fiers , a été fondé sur les principes de la concurrence économique .
P: C' est pourquoi je voudrais souligner que le marché unique est aujourd' hui en danger .
P: Le traité modificatif adopté sous la présidence portugaise représente ce danger .
P: Conformément au mandat de la présidence allemande , la concurrence non faussée devrait être totalement éliminée des objectifs fondamentaux de l' Union , qui sont toujours cruciaux pour résoudre les éventuels différends .
P: Tout ce qui reste , c' est la création d' un marché intérieur par l' Union .
P: La concurrence économique disparaît donc dans un protocole complémentaire qui manque totalement la force du traité de réforme .
P: Une fois le traité adopté , la défense des principes de concurrence non faussée au sein de l' Union sera encore plus difficile qu' aujourd' hui .
P: Cela ne renforcera ni la compétitivité de l' Union ni la satisfaction des consommateurs .

P: Karas report ( A5-0220 / 2001 )
P: Madam President , the Karas report concerns institutions for professional pensions .

P: In 2030 , a French pensioner meets an English pensioner and says :  ⁇   ⁇   ⁇  Tu vu what good pensions will we have ?
P: In 2000 , the people of Europe were receiving less than half of what we see .
P: And what has we achieved ?
P: Because , with a European directive , we have had to make every country to commit all the pension funds paid until then to the state in the professional institutions that have managed the money well and thus done good pensions .
P: The draft directive and the Karas report on supplementary pensions funds and schemes are an additional attack on the existing pensions systems in the European Union .
P: The Karas report is based on the very liberal conclusions of the Feira European Council to approve the directive .
P: Its approach is based on a minimum harmonisation of the rules and a ' Anglo-Saxon ' approach to the regulation , resulting in a lack of precise rules for determining the commitments made by the pension funds .
P: The directive meets the demands of the industry of the pensions funds in English and Dutch , which want to be able to intervene at European level with a single fund , rather than various funds that are located in each country .
P: Once again , the European Union is subject to the dictatorship of the single market , and this time this time , in the pensions sector , with consequences that we are too familiar with : aggravation of inequalities between employees , labouring the financial markets and shareholders on savings and increasing the pressure of pension funds on employment .
P: Instead of harmonising and creating a single European pensions market , we should establish a system based on solidarity and disquiet .
P: That is why we voted against the Karas report and reject the draft directive .
P: Employers have discovered the professional pension funds as a risk source .
P: The leaders consider that these institutions are part of an integrated financial market which must participate in the competitiveness of the European economy .
P: In the hope that the efficiency of the growth of pensions funds , the leaders are confusing them with companies whose sole aim is to generate benefits .
P: In the near future , the shareholders of the banks and insurance companies will benefit from these benefits , pensioners will bear the growing risk arising from the disappearance of protection mechanisms , while no solution will be given to the disadvantages associated with changes in employer or Member State .
P: The proposal for a European directive does not take any account of the motivations which led to the creation of these pension reserves .
P: Pensions are a way of distributing and supplementing people ' s incomes in order to ensure a sustainable standard of living , even when , at the age of 70 , 90 or 110 , these people will no longer be productive .
P: A public pension scheme allocating a reasonable and similar amount of pensions for everyone is the best guarantee that no one will be deprived of their right to income .
P: Professional pensions , as far as they are concerned , are only beneficial for people with high pay .
P: These schemes do not offer any solution to people who have been forced to often change their employer or employment .
P: This is all the more true of additional private pensions , which are only accessible to the people who are able to do and want to put individual funds into an insurance company over the years .

P: L' Agropolis est le symbole ici des bourses grecques , qui , avec ses grands philosophes et penseurs politiques , ont créé le noyau de nos démocraties et de notre renforcement de l' État .
P: Golgotha défend les valeurs sociales et morales de l' Europe , se propage largement dans chaque région de notre vie , d' une compréhension familiale aux droits de l' homme .
P: Le Capitole fait état du droit romain , qui nous aide sur la voie de l' État de droit et d' un sens de la justice .
P: Comme indiqué , cependant , nos pratiques juridiques , alors qu' elles proviennent des mêmes racines , ont augmenté - souvent à part pour autant que ces racines ne soient plus autorisées .
P: La seule base de cette Union européenne semble être le marché intérieur .

P: Cependant , cette situation est loin d' être retirée de toute réalité et , soit dit en passant , de toute expérience de la vie , quand nous vivons dans un monde de plus en plus petit , plus rapide et plus transmissibles .
P: Plus nous expliquons clairement les quatre points sur le marché intérieur - la libre circulation des personnes , des biens , des capitaux et des services - plus nous pouvons les exprimer démocratiquement et dans un contexte de concepts moraux européens , et plus il apparaît clairement que tout cela n' est pas de valeur si nous ne pouvons pas mettre sa forme sur les magistrats d' essai de l' état de droit et de la justice , entre les individus eux-mêmes et entre les individus et le contrôle de l' État .

P: C' est là que l' impact sur l' emploi sera le plus important et c' est précisément ceux-ci qui disposent de la flexibilité et de l' efficacité nécessaires pour la mise en œuvre rapide des innovations .
P: Par-dessus tout , ce sont les priorités de l' Institut qui ont changé .
P: L' Institut européen d' innovation et de technologie , comme son nom le suggère , doit se concentrer sur l' innovation .
P: Les deux autres éléments du triangle de la connaissance , de l' éducation et de la recherche sont importants , mais l' innovation représente clairement l' apex du triangle ; c' est son objectif qui est axé et son principal objectif .
P: Nous devrons investir dans l' éducation de qualité et la recherche de base à l' avenir , mais , comme nous le savons tous , l' innovation est l' échec de l' Europe .
P: Les Américains déposent plus d' un tiers d' autres applications de brevets avec l' Office européen des brevets que les Européens eux-mêmes .
P: Nous avons besoin de produits et services à haute intensité de la connaissance .
P: En 10 ans , la Chine a augmenté sa part de PNB consacrée à la recherche et au développement d' environ zéro à un niveau actuel d' un demi et demi pour cent .
P: Dans pas moins de 17 États membres de l' UE , la part est inférieure à celle de la Chine .
P: La part du PNB de l' UE ancrée par l' investissement dans la recherche et le développement reste nettement supérieure à celle des autres puissances économiques mondiales .
P: Plus alarmant encore est le fait qu' ici , nous avons vu notre part de déclin de l' investissement et non pas augmenté , ces dernières années .
P: Plus ou moins , l' état de capital-risque est mauvais .
P: La stratégie de Lisbonne appelle à une approche dynamique .
P: Pourquoi n' avons-nous pas confiance dans nos propres programmes ?
P: Des niveaux élevés d' éducation et de recherche produisent beaucoup trop peu de demandes commerciales et fonctionnelles , ou du moins elles sont mises en œuvre moins souvent que dans les pays concurrents .
P: Notre système de brevets est également compliqué .
P: La fuite des cerveaux ne devrait-elle pas être une question grave pour une Union qui cherche à être l' économie de la connaissance la plus forte du monde ?
P: L' IET n' éliminera pas ces problèmes , mais il pourrait les atténuer par l' exemple qu' il présente .
P: Il offrira au secteur commercial un nouveau type de lien entre la coopération dans l' éducation et la recherche .
P: Elle créera des possibilités d' exploitation commerciale de la recherche , et elle établira des relations bilatérales plus étroites .
P: L' IET ne deviendra pas une université superstate qui maintient les meilleurs chercheurs pour lui-même ; les amendements du Parlement le garantissent .
P: Après les problèmes d' origine survenus avec le financement , la situation est maintenant claire .
P: L' un des communautés de la connaissance et de l' innovation que j' ai proposé se concentrera sur les technologies de l' information et de la communication .
P: Nous recevons déjà des sommes d' argent considérables dans le monde des affaires .
P: Le financement n' est donc pas un problème .
P: Les enquêtes et les procès seulement ne suffisent pas : nous avons besoin d' une coopération , et à cet effet , l' IET a été créé .
P: L' excellent compromis auquel nous sommes parvenus avec le Conseil est tellement favorable que nous pouvons le dire , et je demanderais donc à chacun de lui apporter son soutien lors du vote qui doit commencer rapidement .

P: au nom du groupe ALDE . - ( PL ) Monsieur le Président , la crise politique actuelle en Arménie n' est pas la première .

P: ( EN ) Madame la Présidente , il s' agit d' un domaine complexe et je félicite certainement Mme Attwooll pour son rapport et ses efforts à cet égard .

P: Au lieu de cela , je suis assez clair que les États membres devraient pouvoir décider du meilleur système de gestion qui leur fonctionne .

P: Il serait préférable , d' une part , de rapatuer de véritables pouvoirs sur la pêche aux États membres et de se concentrer sur la mise en place de systèmes de gestion locale viables capables de profiter de la confiance des personnes affectées .

P: Je ne partage donc pas la vision des écosystèmes marins ni les communautés de pêcheurs associées comme un marché , où les droits de pêche peuvent être vendus librement , peut-être même sur un marché du stock , qui , bien sûr , entraînerait la industrialisation de la pêche et représentent une menace pour l' équilibre des écosystèmes et des communautés de la pêche .

P: De plus , la gestion de la pêche devra être de plus en plus basée sur des approches adaptatives , car les données historiques seront moins utiles .

P: I voted in favour of this report .

P: I therefore welcome the willingness shown by our Parliament to create and develop this interdisciplinary and Community area .
P: In France , in particular , there is a worrying reduction in the number of researchers .
P: Because of disappointing national policies , the most talentuous are often turning out outside our borders and are just too rarely .
P: Therefore , the integrated system in this report , with regard to the mobility of researchers and the return aid , will enable us to overcome the shortcomings of certain governments .
P: Stimulating research means also ensuring independent training policy based on existing competences at European level .
P: If the legislator can have the task of regulating research , the risk is to ban it on too tight a stroke .
P: Therefore , the Europe of discovery must be promoted , and work on biotechnologies , which represent the future , is appropriate to be encouraged .
P: As must the fundamental European research that lies at the heart of the competitiveness of our industries , and the numerous work undertaken by small and medium-sized enterprises ( SMEs ) , of which we know the necessary contribution to discovery and innovation .
P: Research also relates to the daily life of all Europeans , and priority areas such as food security , combating the major scourge and improving public health show the will to link research and welfare .
P: I am also pleased to note the support proposed for developing research into children 's diseases , where national policies have often failed .
P: I therefore expect the Commission to publish proposals on paediatric medicines .
P: Research and development are of decisive importance if Europe is to be able to be a continent characterised by economic growth and prosperity .
P: International competition , especially that of the United States , is increasing the need for new , greater efforts , efforts for researchers .
P: In its proposal for the 6th Framework Programme , the Commission has identified a number of important problems and research areas on which Europe must build .
P: Of course it is important for European researchers to cooperate and for efforts in the field of research to be , in some way , coordinated .
P: It is also very important that we do not work to promote the physical mobility of researchers , but that we encourage the dissemination of the results of their research .
P: What concerns us is that the framework programme provides for a quite considerable centralisation of research .
P: Important resources are being invested in a small number of areas of selection .
P: This will lead to research in an unwelcome manner , since the particular guidelines of the various Member States on research will be governed by the priorities set out to the Commission .
P: For the small countries that have only a modest research budget , the EU will therefore be in danger of becoming the main source of funding for this work , which constitutes a centralisation that I believe is negative .
P: As liberals , we advocate the principle of freedom of research .
P: From the point of view of efficiency , free research has demonstrated its superiority in the research commanded by the political authorities .
P: A society which leaves its researchers a great deal of room for manoeuvre when it comes to the choice of subjects and methods , succeeds in the long term with better results than a society in which the research guidelines are defined by the political class .
P: The principle of freedom applied to the human quest for knowledge has , for centuries , markedly marked research in Europe .
P: Higher education schools and universities play an important role in cooperating with the public sector and the players in economic activity , but their main task must not be to receive the orders of each other .
P: We believe that the Sixth Framework Programme establishes an excessive centralisation of free research .
P: We have therefore chosen to abstain in the vote on the Caudron report .
P: Le débat est clos .

P: par écrit . - ( EN ) Les États membres de l' UE et le Conseil doivent prendre l' initiative de négocier un traité international visant à introduire une interdiction du développement , de la production , du stockage , du transfert , de l' essai et de l' utilisation d' armes d' uranium .

P: Mr Mitchell , the Treaty defines stability as the main mandate .
P: The main mandate of the European Central Bank is to maintain stable prices .
P: Once this mandate or principal objective has been achieved , or as it is achieved , the mandate is to ensure that monetary policy is coordinated with the rest of economic policy objectives .
P: That is something to which the ECB itself and the other European institutions must take care .
P: What does the ECB mean by price stability ?
P: I believe that this has been clearly defined in 2003 , if I am not mistaken .
P: This means less than 2 % inflation , but very close to 2 % in the medium term .
P: For all these years , from 1999 to now on , this objective is just less than 2 % has meant trying to keep inflation at a low level .
P: Next year , if forecasts are correct , price stability could , for the first time , be interpreted as an attempt to maintain the 2 % without exceeding them , because we are probably going to live up to a situation in which not only with monthly inflation , but perhaps even the forecasts of inflation in the medium term are going to fall below the 2 % mark .
P: The mandate will remain the same , however .
P: The instruments used and the methods for achieving the objectives will be different , of course , but the objective will remain the same .
P: The second area of activity or actions of any central bank and , of course , of the European Central Bank , is to make liquidity available .
P: This is extremely important at present .
P: I believe that the ECB does what it has to do , but it does not make secret of the fact - it says quite openly - that it provides liquidity this morning , but normally , before closing the shop at the end of the day , it has the liquidity of the financial institutions that have not used this liquidity for their credit operations .
P: This has now been a debate : in recent days , newspapers publish statements by the Vice-President of the ECB , Mr Papademos , and other leaders , that the bank and the way in which it is debated how it should use the necessary instruments to ensure that this provision of liquidity is effective and not just a circular operation that ends up returning to the money in place in the morning .
P: I now turn to the second question , which is the difference .
P: In some EU Member States outside the euro area , inflation is higher than in the vast majority of euro area countries .
P: If you read the note that Eurostat took over this morning on inflation at the end of November , you will see that most European countries outside the euro area have a higher inflation rate than the country with the highest rate of inflation within the euro area .
P: There is therefore more inflation outside , to a large extent , because there are countries outside this area that are experiencing a rapid convergence process where there is greater inflationary pressure due to a series of more marred effects on the use of energy , greater dependency on the foreign energy sources , the price increased , or the Balassa-Samon effect , technical jargon .
P: In a comparison by sector , inflation is clearly higher in the services sector .
P: Despite the very rapid fall in inflation in recent months , you will see that inflation in the services sector has remained rather constant , to 2.5-2.6 % .
P: The inflation in the food sector , food preparations and industrial products has fluctuated much more for the reasons I have outlined before in my reply to Mr Medina Ortega .
P: However , the services sector has retained a higher rate of inflation to the objective of price stability , which is to remain below the 2 % mark .
P: However , its rate remains at the same time as 2 % .
P: Nova : Organisation for Economic Cooperation of the European Union
P: Economic union , with its shortcomings , and the full monetary union that has been accused of an asymmetries in terms of regulatory pressure and its complete complete binding character .
P: What should , in the Commission 's view , be the strategic orientation to bring about the European Union 's economic governance in order to overcome this asymmetries ?
P: Madam President , Mr Papastamkos asked me about governance in the euro area .
P: I have just mentioned governance in the monetary pillar of the Economic and Monetary Union , the European Central Bank and the European Central Bank system of central banks .
P: Very frankly , I think it is working very well .
P: I think this is a success .
P: Governance in the other pillar , the economic pillar of the Economic and Monetary Union , works , but there is still a great deal to be done .
P: Tax and budgetary policy coordination works , and I believe that so far since the 2005 review , the Stability and Growth Pact and fiscal coordination have been implicit in the implementation of the PAC working very well .
P: We are now subject to a very severe test because , as a result of the economic slowdown and the measures for tax incentives , the more the packages designed to support the financial system , public finances are under extreme pressure and the Stability and Growth Pact must be implemented in a very difficult context .
P: It must be implemented with the flexibility that it has , whilst maintaining and complying with the rules of the PAC , and this will be a major test .
P: There is a second factor that is also analysed in our report on the first ten years of the Economic and Monetary Union .
P: Beyond the coordination of our fiscal and budgetary policies , I believe that it is necessary to improve the coordination of our macroeconomic policies .
P: There are very significant macroeconomic imbalances in certain countries , including Hungary and Latvia , which are currently experiencing considerable difficulties with their balance of payments and are calling for substantial financial assistance from our part and from the Monetary Fund .
P: This shows that there has been an accumulation of imbalances that we could not correct in time through our coordination system .
P: These are countries that do not belong to the Economic and Monetary Union and which are at the third stage with the euro .
P: Even within the euro area , however , there are differences in current accounting deficits and in the development of the unitary labour cost .
P: In my opinion , they need more effective coordination than the one we have been able to provide up to now , despite the efforts of the Eurogroup in this regard .
P: I believe that the Eurogroup has done a great deal better since the Prime Minister of Luxembourg , Mr Juncker , took the Presidency in 2005 and has installed a stable Presidency .
P: However , there is still a lot to be done in terms of internal coordination of macroeconomic policies or of structural reforms , which go beyond budgetary coordination , and there is clearly a lot to be done in terms of external coordination .
P: I believe that as a currency , the euro is sufficiently important for us and the rest of the world not to allow us to fail to allow us to allow the interests , positions and priorities of the euro in the countries of the euro area to be represented in the multilateral forums and institutions in a consistent , systematic and integrated manner .

P: I do not agree with this report when it states are bound to adopt the same format of identity coins for their nationals and for the citizens of other Member States , although there are indeed great differences between the different identity coins .
P: I think that this solution is pointless and superficiel .
P: According to Article 18 of the EC Treaty , every citizen is free to move freely and live throughout the territory of the Member States .
P: Directive 2004 / 38 / EC specifies in detail the various legal opportunities for the movement of citizens , their relatives or a trustworthy partner within the EU 's borders .
P: Freedom of movement must , however , be considered in relation to the regulations on the free movement of workers and the freedom to provide services .
P: As we all know , four EU Member States have still not opened up their labour market to workers from countries that joined the Union in 2004 .
P: Not least 11 EU Member States continue to apply restrictions on their labour market to Romanian and Bulgarian citizens .
P: I believe that this situation has a negative impact and not just on the integration process .
P: We must do everything we can to eliminate obstacles that persist as quickly as possible .
P: According to Article 20 of the EU Treaty , every citizen benefits from a third country where the Member State of which he is a citizen is not represented , from the protection of the diplomatic and consulary authorities of any Member State under the same conditions as the national states .
P: The measures announced to ensure consulaire protection in third countries must be implemented as quickly as possible and the negotiations with third countries on the withdrawal of the visa requirement must continue .
P: Mrs Gacek 's report highlights one important point : when the European Union enlarged , there has been a significant increase in the number of European citizens resident outside their state of origin , in a context where European citizenship complements national citizenship of the Member States , all of which are responsible for regulating this aspect .
P: Despite the active participation of citizens in the formulation of legislative proposals and the attempts to make the Community legislative system more transparent , Europeans are still facing a number of problems linked to violations and non-compliance with citizens ' right to move freely and reside where they want it on the territory of the Member States .
P: The disparities identified between Member States with regard to regulating visa requirements or exercising the right to vote in the country of origin and the adoption country seriously question the equal rights of all European citizens .
P: That is why I believe that the Member States must take all necessary steps to transpose standards to harmonise the rights of European citizens effectively .
P: In the specific case before us , we must bear in mind that the starting point is partnership , whether between Member States and the EU or between regional , local and civil institutions .
P: Last but not least , Member States must guarantee the right to vote for all EU citizens resident in another Member State than their country of origin in parliamentary elections .

P: I would therefore like to remind everyone once again of the original intention , because our current discussions on the External Action Service , the High Representative and Vice-President of the Commission are one of the results of the Constitutional Convention , including the Intergovernmental Conference on the Treaty of Lisbon .
P: The intention was to make the European Union more efficient by moving towards a situation in which Europe would speak with one voice .
P: That is why we need this new type of High Representative and Vice-President , who must have a reliable service in order to be equal to the task it will have .
P: The second principle of the Constitutional Convention was transparency , and the third of democracy .
P: This was the three starting points and , for the majority in Parliament in the Constitutional Convention , which was made up of national Members , it was clear that the European Union is always better in the areas in which it acts under the Community method and is quite poor in the areas in which it operates under the intergovernmental method .
P: In line with the spirit of these preparations , the implementation of the Treaty must not lead to a strengthening of the intergovernmental approach , with the corollary that the Community method , which is more supervised from a democratic , more efficient and more transparent point of view , is phased out .

P: Mr President , Commissioner , Mr Brok , ladies and gentlemen , the establishment of the European External Action Service is an issue which , I know , is very expensive for this Parliament .
P: I have read with great interest and a great feeling of involvement in the report tabled by Mr Brok and endorsed on Monday by the Committee on Constitutional Affairs .
P: Naturally , the Presidency fully agrees with what Mr Brok said in his report , namely that the European External Action Service is essential to our joint efforts to make European foreign policy an active and more coherent instrument to enable European policy to be perceived in a better day in the world .
P: The aim is to fill the gap between the work of the Commission and the Council so that Union 's policies go along the same lines .
P: We need it to become as efficient as possible .
P: It is therefore crucial that we give the External Action Service the best blow to send .
P: This is one of the biggest and most important challenges in the Treaty of Lisbon .
P: Many parts of the puzzle have yet to find their place and for this reason large-scale preparations are being made in the Council .
P: Our objective is for the European Council to approve a report that the High Representative , when appointed , will be able to use as a starting point to submit a proposal on the External Action Service .
P: In the meantime , the European Parliament will , of course , be consulted on the submission of this proposal by the High Representative .
P: By then , the President will ensure that there is regular dialogue with the European Parliament .
P: We have had this dialogue up to now and will continue to do so .
P: It is important for the European Parliament , the Council and the Commission to have regular contacts on these issues , not only between officials , but also at a political level .
P: The result of the Irish referendum - and we are delighted with the positive result - has been achieved by the Member States and the Commission in order to prepare the European External Action Service .
P: This work is continuing and I am absolutely sure that we will be able to put forward a number of sound ideas to the European Council next week regarding the future High Representative .
P: Since it will be the High Representative to submit the final proposal , he will , of course , be involved in these work , to second-designate .
P: This is essential in order to enable him to help shape the proposal .
P: The Presidency will submit an agreement of principle on five major elements , namely the scale of the activities of the External Action Service , its legal status , its staff and its financing and EU delegations .
P: We have not yet concluded this and the discussions are still under way , but I am going to give you an idea of where we are and , in this regard , there seems to be a significant agreement between the Council and the Commission and , I hope , with the European Parliament as well .
P: With regard to the scale of the activities of the European External Action Service , it is clear that we need to define ' geographical and thematic functions ' , with collective responsibility for the tasks currently undertaken by the Commission and the Council Secretariat .
P: The Commission will remain the main responsibility for the issues relating to trade , aid and enlargement , even though it is still necessary to decide where exactly the separation line between the Commission and the External Action Service is based on aid .
P: The Member States and the Commission also agree to recognise that the legal status of the External Action Service must reflect and support the unique , sui generis , which is its role in the European Union system .
P: Whatever the solution that will ultimately be adopted , it will have to respect the principles of good governance and accountability .
P: The staff will be recruited by the Commission , the Council Secretariat and the Member States .
P: This is clearly indicated in the Treaty of Lisbon .
P: All these categories of staff must be able to take on a position of equality .
P: EU delegations will be placed under the authority of the High Representative when the Treaty of Lisbon entered into force .
P: Another important point concerning the establishment of the European External Action Service is contact with the European Parliament .
P: Once the High Representative appointed , he will consult the European Parliament regularly on the broad directions to be taken and on the important choices to be made in the area of the common security and defence policy .
P: I am convinced that these contacts bringing with the European Parliament closer to the European Parliament will also be encouraged at the level of civil servants .
P: The European External Action Service must provide itself with a structure responsible for contacts with Parliament .
P: This is quite moderate when we have arrived in the discussions .
P: I cannot give you any further details , because we have not yet reached the final point in our talks , but we will do everything in our power to keep Parliament informed of the progress made .
P: Of course , the High Representative has not yet been appointed and it is therefore only about the spirit , nothing more .
P: Finally , it is the High Representative who will submit the proposal in accordance with the provisions of the Treaty .
P: Finally , I am grateful for this opportunity to speak to me , and I hope that we will have a constructive debate , during which I am , of course , very carefully listening to Parliament 's opinion and I will answer your questions as best .

P: La question clé pour nous tous est ce que le SEAE devrait pouvoir apporter .
P: Tel devrait être notre objectif .
P: En rassemblant les différents acteurs dans le domaine des relations extérieures , nous pouvons faire en sorte que nos relations avec le monde extérieur soient claires , cohérentes et guidées par un seul ensemble d' objectifs de politique .
P: Il doit exercer l' autorité en tant que noyau de la politique extérieure de l' UE , le lieu où la politique est développée et coordonnée .
P: Il faut également que ce soit le cas , tant à l' intérieur qu' à l' extérieur de l' Union européenne , et le SEAE ne sera efficace que s' il travaille bien avec d' autres institutions et respecte pleinement l' équilibre interinstitutionnel .
P: C' est pourquoi je pense qu' il est très important que le SEAE soit créé d' une manière qui lui permette de travailler très étroitement avec la Commission et le Conseil et de respecter la nécessité d' être pleinement responsables au Parlement européen .
P: Pour le Parlement , l' instauration de responsabilités d' action extérieure dans un seul service entraînera , je crois , une modification de la capacité du Parlement à remplir son rôle d' examen de la politique de l' Union .
P: Comme le service lui-même , la manière dont le Parlement porte sur le service et le haut-représentant devra également être sui generis d' une manière ou d' une autre .
P: La création du SEAE nécessitera une série de décisions , sans doute y compris des modifications du règlement financier et du règlement des fonctionnaires , qui exigent à la fois une proposition de la Commission et l' adoption par la codécision .
P: Le haut-représentant a besoin de l' autorité pour gérer le service , mais le service doit également servir le système de l' UE dans son ensemble - plus évidemment , le président de la Commission européenne et le président du Conseil européen , ainsi que les autres commissaires qui ont un rôle à jouer dans les relations extérieures .
P: Il doit pouvoir apporter son aide , tant à Bruxelles que dans les pays tiers , au Parlement européen et à ses délégations officielles qui se rendent à l' étranger .
P: L' implication étroite des États membres dans le nouveau service est l' une de ses principales innovations .
P: Les ambassadeurs de COREPER se tournent vers le meilleur moyen de faire en sorte que les diplomates des États membres de haute qualité puissent être intégrés au service au plus tôt .
P: Nous , au sein de la Commission , examinons comment cela peut se faire dans l' attente de la modification du statut des fonctionnaires , et la désignation au service devrait être via des procédures de sélection basées sur le mérite , en tenant dûment compte de la nécessité d' un équilibre géographique et de genre .
P: Ceci répond tout à fait aux souhaits exprimés dans le rapport .
P: Nous pensons également que tous les membres du SEAE , que les fonctionnaires des institutions de l' UE ou les fonctionnaires des États membres soient tenus de bénéficier des mêmes droits .
P: Ils seront égaux dans tous les sens .
P: En ce qui concerne le champ d' application du service , elle doit disposer d' un aperçu complet des relations de l' Union avec le reste du monde , et elle a donc besoin de services géographiques et horizontaux pour couvrir des questions telles que la PESC et la PSDC , les droits de l' homme et les relations avec les organes de l' ONU .
P: L' objectif est de prévenir la duplication et de s' assurer que tous les responsables de la réalisation de la politique extérieure de l' UE travaillent efficacement ensemble , et la Commission continuera également à avoir des services responsables de la politique commerciale , du développement , de la mise en œuvre de l' aide , de l' aide humanitaire et de l' élargissement .
P: Elle continuera aussi , bien sûr , à conduire les aspects extérieurs des principales politiques internes de l' Union , et une question centrale au cours du débat actuel est de savoir comment gérer la programmation de l' aide extérieure .
P: Je peux assurer au Parlement que la politique de développement de l' UE , y compris l' éradication de la pauvreté , constituera un élément central des activités extérieures de la Commission .
P: La haute représentante et la commissaire au développement travailleront de très près à cet égard .
P: Le fait que la nouvelle haute représentante sera aussi la vice-présidente de la Commission , responsable de la coordination de l' ensemble de l' action extérieure de l' UE , contribuera .
P: Le service sera également responsable de l' administration des délégations , même si les personnes à l' intérieur des délégations viendront , comme maintenant , des différents services - pas seulement le SEAE , mais aussi les services de la Commission et peut-être d' autres institutions et organes de l' Union européenne .
P: De l' entrée en vigueur du traité , les délégations de la Commission deviendront des délégations de l' UE .

P: Les délégations de l' UE doivent être responsables de la représentation , de la coordination et de la négociation à partir du jour où le traité entrera en vigueur .
P: Dans la plupart des endroits , cette procédure se déroule sans heurts .

P: Nous apprendreons ensemble .

P: At a time when cohesion policy plays an essential role in combating the economic crisis and climate change , the Council proposed cutting substantially the payment appropriations allocated to it in 2010 .
P: In view of the importance of European funds and the expectations that exist on the ground , it was essential for MEPs to restore , or even in some cases , the sums suggested before the European Commission .
P: This vote is the expression of the political Europe that we need , which is capable of making budgetary choices that ensure a future of solidarity , competitiveness and growth , which will serve the citizens .
P: Today , MEPs have confirmed their support for a European cohesion policy that really has the means of achieving its ambitions .
P: At the same time , it is with determination that I endorsed their adoption that Mr Surj ⁇ n and Mr Ma ⁇ ka 's reports on the European Union 's draft budget for the financial year 2010 .
P: I support the Surj ⁇ n report , which is a possible compromise with regard to the EU budget .
P: I regret that the Council has reduced the Commission 's preliminary draft budget even further , which , in my opinion , was already less than what is needed .
P: We cannot strengthen Europe with a bad budget that is clearly inadequate .
P: In particular , I disagree with the cuts that have been made in support of the Lisbon Strategy .
P: The gap between public commitments to be tackled as a matter of priority as a matter of combating the economic crisis and of supporting ' competitiveness for growth and employment ' , and the appropriations allocated to this end in this draft budget , could no longer be reduced .
P: I welcome the increased appropriations in the area of freedom , security and justice , and would like to stress that the construction of a citizens ' Europe also depends on the proper implementation of these budget lines .
P: I did not vote in favour of the creation of a fund of EUR 300 million and of immediate support for milk producers , as I believe that dairy farmers are faced with a collapse of prices , causing insecurity .
P: Indeed , the position adopted by the Group of the Progressive Alliance of Socialists and Democrats in the European Parliament ( S  ⁇  D ) in favour of a fund of EUR 600 million would have provided a faster and more efficient way of combating the causes and , above all , the effects that led to a significant drop in the dairy market , which is continuing in the current economic crisis .
P: I also believe that the series of measures adopted by the European Commission came too late .
P: Indeed , the fund of EUR 600 million would have provided real support to Member States facing this crisis .
P: The group of amendments to the EU budget for 2010 , which form the ' Block 3 ' , provides for interventions and support measures that we are against in principle ( just as we criticise - and vote against - the EU 's support for tobacco cultivation ) .
P: These include various storage measures , for example , for alcohol , and for the EU 's unanimous support for the wine sector .
P: It is also EU support for the distribution of milk and fruit in schools , which is , in itself , important , but we believe that this issue should rather be decided at national level .
P: At the same time , the group of amendments that have been mentioned as ' Block 3 ' contains important investments in animal welfare and the monitoring of animal transport , for example , which we would , in principle , be pleased about , as we absolutely support these issues in other respects , but because the voting procedure forces us to consider the group of amendments as a whole , we have decided to abstain from voting on Block 3 .
P: I voted in favour of the creation of this microfinance facility for employment , since it aims to provide opportunities for the unemployed and encourage entrepreneurship .
P: This instrument , which is intended for those who wish to create or develop microbusiness ( less than 10 employees and a turnover figure that does not exceed EUR 2 million ) , will open up new opportunities for many people without jobs .
P: Given the current state of the economy , it would have been worth launching this important programme earlier , as it has been a long time now that people have difficulty accessing credit .
P: Given that this instrument is aimed at public and private bodies offering micro-credits to individuals and micro-enterprises at national , regional and local level in EU Member States , it must be carefully supervised by the competent bodies in order to ensure that the credit actually achieves the place where it is most necessary and that we do not see this happening again during the last financial crisis .

P: L' ordre du jour appelle le débat sur les déclarations du Conseil et de la Commission sur le résultat du sommet de Copenhague sur le changement climatique .
P: Mr President , ladies and gentlemen , I am here today in Parliament to share with you my impressions on the results of the Copenhagen Summit and the resulting challenges for both the European Union and the rotating Presidency and Spain in the first half of 2010 .
P: The European Union 's environmental ministers have debated these issues at length last weekend .
P: I must point out that we broadly agree on our desire to continue our progress , particularly on three issues : on the basis of the results of the summit in order to make them available as soon as possible , to strengthen their elements within the framework of the United Nations and , lastly , to ensure that we fulfil our objectives for reducing total emissions .
P: We have common objectives and strategies .
P: As a result , our most urgent tasks will be to complete the process of formal announcement of our commitment , to consolidate a framework of action comparable to that of the other industrialised and emerging nations and , lastly , to use all the tools at our disposal , both within the European Union and in our relations with third countries .
P: The December Summit - an extremely complex conference which has characterised difficult procedural discussions - concluded with the so-called Copenhagen agreement .
P: Many Heads of State or Government and Heads of Regional Groups were personally involved in drawing up the adopted document , which represents the wish of the countries whose total emissions by more than 80 % of the world 's emissions .
P: Participators have been deported to all industrialised countries , the major emerging economies and a significant number of countries that are particularly vulnerable .
P: This document should also help us to raise the many doubts that continue to emulate the official process before us to find legally binding solutions within the framework of the United Nations and preferably in Mexico .
P: With regard to the content of the agreement , I think it is important to stress that we are clearly supporting not making it possible to increase the temperature of more than two degrees .
P: This is certainly one of the most important points in the results and the one that has the greatest potential : the commitment of all industrialised countries to establish a reduction target that can be applied to all their economies .
P: The emerging nations will , in turn , take concrete and verifiable measures that will enable them to substantially reduce the growth of their emissions : funding based on solidarity and support immediate and medium-term measures to combat climate change ; elements intended to bring about new governance models ; and mechanisms for technological development and the reduction of emissions from deforestation .
P: The Copenhagen Summit has shown that we are moving in a new international context , a context which requires improvements if we are to provide solutions to global problems .
P: The rules of the decision-making process in place must be changed in such a way as to adapt properly to these times and to these needs of a new kind .
P: We have the necessary tools to act : an already in place legislative instrument at Community level ; the strict commitment to continue to reduce emissions , international solidarity and innovation and technological cooperation ; and the correct institutional structure within the Union for which we must use with intelligence , making full use of its complementarity .
P: During the negotiations and the planning of policies on climate change , we will have to combine the Environment Authority with greater external action capacity .
P: Furthermore , we should make the link between the environmental mission ahead of us and the opinions of our experts on policies on the economy and innovation ; we should also improve the coherence between our climate goals and our model of development and prosperity .
P: All this must be done without losing sight of the need - both in the European Union and outside - to consolidate the role of public opinion and law makers who commit to investing in a better future and protecting the general interest .
P: Let us use our collective European experience .
P: Firstly , we must exert pressure in order to obtain an appropriate response before 31 January .
P: By bringing together all those who have to cut their emissions , the Copenhagen agreement allows for a comparison of the efforts to be made , compared with the European Union required ; however , we are not some of the firm commitment of the other countries .
P: If it is not enough , we will be forced to continue our efforts to intensify our collective cuts .
P: We will also have to create the conditions for the swift application of the elements of the agreement .
P: It is essential for the European Union and its Member States to be at the vape of the countries that keep their promises .
P: For this reason , we will have to make the transfer of funds planned for the 2010-2012 period as soon as possible .
P: We want to develop a financial framework that can support our solidarity commitments to third countries within the Copenhagen climate fund and , at the same time , encourage improvements in the accounting rules and our response in terms of reducing emissions from deforestation and technological cooperation .
P: The following elements must be added : our own policies , aimed at achieving our objectives of reducing emissions at both local and Community level ; stimulating by innovation and smart use of energy ; incorporating adaptation measures for sectoral policies ; consistent external action .
P: We want to work closely with the Commission and Parliament on all these areas , making efforts to define us as a leading region in the fight against climate change , to the weakest carbon emissions , to the best preparedness to address the challenges posed by climate change and the most effective task of making these elements a powerful force of innovation and competitiveness .
P: Our policy on climate change is one of the main features of the European model .
P: We were the first to incorporate this principle into our proposals for more sustainable and fairer development , not only economically but also socially and environmentally , while at the same time being aware that we are strengthening international security .
P: This has allowed key players , such as China and the United States , to sit at the same negotiating table and define and share decisive cooperation points .
P: The European Union , which is a fervent advocate of the role being played by the United Nations in resolving global problems , will also have a role to play in other areas , both bilateral and multilateral , informal and informal areas , by helping everyone to define the opportunities , listening to our partners and by working towards consolidating sectoral responses that correspond to our needs in the fight against climate change .
P: We must take full advantage of the adoption of the Treaty of Lisbon and of the entry into force of the new institutions , in order to systematically integrate the essential messages of the fight against climate change into our relations with third countries .
P: It is not a sincerity that awaits us .
P: The Spanish Government is well aware of the scale of the challenge and wants to demonstrate here that it is committed to making as much progress as possible on the elements that can help to sign an ambitious and binding agreement in Mexico .
P: We cannot allow the political opportunity created in Copenhagen or to reduce our expectations or that of the international community .
P: It is our credibility that is at stake .
P: We must keep our eye right .
P: The European Parliament 's new powers , which bring it closer to the citizens , will enable closer and more fruitful cooperation .
P: I wish to conclude my speech by congratulating everyone on this and reminding you all that , more than ever , we need your work and support during the crucial period of the next six months .
