P: Déclarations écrites ( article 149 )
P: The financial crisis has contributed to a severe deterioration in the social situation of the European population .
P: Recovery has taken time to emerge , the unemployment rate is high and weak economic growth is low .
P: The Europe 2020 strategy ( EU 2020 ) is intended to set up a programme to facilitate the creation of economic growth that can provide more jobs and greater competitiveness within the Union .
P: Its emblematic initiatives constitute a way for us to be followed in order to make Europe more inclusive for Europeans .
P: The Treaty of Lisbon strengthens the dimension of European social policy .
P: Europe belongs to the people of Europe and part of its mission is to contribute to promoting employment and to improving living and working conditions .
P: I would like to emphasise the crucial nature of dialogue between the social partners and the role of small and medium-sized enterprises as the driving force of the economy .
P: We must achieve the objectives of the Treaty of Lisbon as regards social issues through the specific proposals included in the Europe 2020 strategy ; for example , emblematic initiatives such as ' A industrial policy in the age of globalisation ' or ' a strategy for new skills and jobs ' .
P: Europe must be more competitive and able to cope with the challenges of globalisation without , however , refraining from being inclusive and aimed at sustainable development that guarantees social integration .
P: The Treaty of Lisbon reconfirmes the commitment of the Member States to respect the basic social rights enshrined in the European Social Charter ( 1961 ) and in the Community Charter of Fundamental Social Rights of the workers ( in 1989 ) .
P: It reaffirms that the European Union is working towards Europe 's sustainable development .
P: The European economy is a social market economy , promoting a high level of competitiveness .
P: Its objectives include full employment , social progress and a high level of protection and better environmental quality .
P: The EU is fighting against social exclusion and discrimination and promoting justice and social protection , gender equality , intergenerational solidarity and the protection of children 's rights .
P: In August , the unemployment rate in the EU-27 was 9.6 % , with unemployment among young people at 20 % .
P: The economic and financial crisis has had dramatic repercussions on the social environment , with the European citizens ' main concern at the moment being to find a job and ensure good quality of life .
P: The European Union is primarily its 500 million citizens , which is why Europe must take a social aspect .
P: Social Europe must provide European citizens with jobs and a decent life , high quality education and opportunities for integration into the labour market for its young people , as well as a decent life and quality health care services for its pensioners .

P: I voted in favour of Parliament 's position because I think that :
P: the current directive does not regulate alternative investment funds , which can always be regulated and monitored at national level ;
P: It is necessary to ensure that the actions of alternative investment fund managers are subject to close monitoring at the level of governance ;
P: It should be explicitly necessary for players to apply and maintain compatible policies and practices with sound and effective risk management for categories of staff whose professional activities have a significant impact on the risk profile of alternative investment funds they manage ;
P: The obligations for information and dissemination and specific safeguards against asset stripping should be subject to a general exemption for monitoring small and medium-sized enterprises ( SMEs ) ;
P: it is necessary to clarify the powers and obligations of the competent authorities responsible for the implementation of this directive and to strengthen the mechanisms for ensuring effective cross-border cooperation in the field of monitoring .
P: In Europe , alternative investment fund managers are responsible for managing a considerable amount of invested assets .
P: They represent an important proportion of trade in the financial instruments markets and can exert a significant influence on the markets and companies in which they invest .
P: I am sure that the impact of alternative investment fund managers on the markets where they are important , but the recent financial difficulties have highlighted the fact that the activities of investment fund managers can also contribute to the development and spread of risks in the financial system and the economy .
P: The aim of this directive must also be to create incentives for the transfer of offshore funds to the Union , which would bring advantages in the regulation and protection of investors , while setting the appropriate level of income for managers , funds and alternative investors .
P: I would like to stress , in this sitting , that , by providing uncoordinated national responses to these risks , we will have difficulty managing them efficiently .
P: I am voting against this report because it only serves to regulate the behaviour of alternative investment funds companies , without touching on the nature or composition of the financial products in question .
P: This commitment to the ' creativity ' of the financial sector forgets the intrinsic scale of the speculation , which is crucial with this type of fund .
P: The proposed rules are also extraordinarily weak .
P: They include so many exceptions and derogations at European level that they are not really devoid of the model of the various national regulations currently in place .
P: The report also omits a clear distinction between those working with this type of fund and those working on traditional banking activities , as well as blocking the actions of speculative funds placed in tax havens .
P: Instead , by setting ' thresholds ' for the value of ' systemic importance ' assets , it paves the way for fragmentation processes , which will eliminate its scope enormously from the scope of investment companies that are intended to be covered by the directive .
P: The safety of European public assets is a public good which is too great in order to allow it to be exposed to the timidity of the proposed directive .
P: The financial crisis has highlighted the need to submit the activities of the various financial markets to close monitoring , in particular , organized regimes involved in managing and managing alternative investment funds .
P: In fact , the impact of alternative investment fund managers on the markets where they are active is of great benefit , but the recent financial difficulties have demonstrated that their activities have been exposed to a wide range of risks , and that they need to be properly managed , with a coherent framework that is valid for the whole of the European Union .
P: Indeed , it has been demonstrated that the introduction of a harmonised regulatory and supervisory framework at European level is adapted to the cross-border nature of the risks inherent in the activity of alternative investment fund managers , thereby contributing to the strengthening of the internal market .
P: For all these reasons , I voted in favour of Parliament 's position .

P: The European directive on speculative funds , private equity funds and other alternative investment funds , launched by the European Commission in April 2009 in response to the financial crisis and in line with the guidelines set out at the G20 Summit , has finally been approved by a very large majority .
P: This is a further step towards the European ambition to have operational financial governance from the beginning of 2011 .
P: These new rules would make the international financial system more responsible and transparent and would allow speculation to be restricted .
P: According to this directive , investors from speculative funds based in non-EU countries ( speculative managers often live in tax havens ) will be forced to comply with the same conditions as those imposed on all European companies if they are to act on the European market .
P: In order to obtain this ' European passport ' to the EU 's competent supervisory authorities , alternative fund managers will therefore have to accept clear rules , limits to speculation and greater transparency .

P: I voted in favour of the report on the demographic challenge and solidarity between generations because , in the current context of unprecedented demographic problems posed by the rise in life expectancy and the fall in birth rates , these are one of the most urgent social policy challenges for the years to come .

P: As a result of the sous-estimation of the credit risk , credit rating agencies were one of the factors that has been triggered by the global financial crisis .
P: Furthermore , there is no genuine competition in the credit rating agencies sector .
P: This situation increases the risk of conflicts of interest and , by extension , of lack of transparency and quality in the allocation of notes to the various financial instruments .
P: The regulation providing for the creation of the European Securities and Markets Authority will enter into force on 1 January 2011 .
P: Its main prerogative will be to monitor the agencies of this kind .
P: The establishment of a mechanism for monitoring and supervising credit rating agencies at European Union level is crucial .
P: I believe that this new authority must exercise its mandate from its creation .
P: I would like to point out that the decision taken by the United States to establish stricter control rules has opened the way for global harmonisation .
P: The European Union has already laid down rules which will come into force at the end of the year .
P: The rules applicable to credit rating agencies that wish to operate in the European Union , and thus obtain a licence , include , in particular , the obligation to register and comply with , and comply with , specific rules on transparency and rules of ' good conduct ' .
P: I do not believe that these rules are strict enough and I welcome the additional measures we are discussing in the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs .
P: These agencies are currently in a lot of power and can plunder a state and even a system ( lowering the note of country and causing a panic on the world market ) in a situation of crisis with a lack of ratings .
P: Their work is important in terms of guaranteeing reliability and stability , but doubts remain as to the rules and criteria on the basis of their ratings .
P: Therefore , Mr Gauzès ' report , which proposes to put credit rating agencies under the supervision of the European Securities and Markets Authority , goes in the right direction .

P: I voted in favour of the report on an EU strategy for the Black Sea .
P: The strategic importance of the Black Sea region for the EU was recognised in 2007 , in the context of the accession of Romania and Bulgaria to the EU .
P: As developments in this region , which is strategically situated between Europe , the Middle East and Central Asia , have begun to have a direct impact on the EU 's internal affairs , it has acknowledged the need to consider greater involvement in the region .
P: This has led the EU to take a new political approach to the region , called Black Sea Synergy .
P: The aim of the Black Sea Synergy is to develop cooperation between the EU and the region , as well as cooperation within the region .
P: However , less results have been achieved in the implementation of the strategy , while aspects such as stability , democracy and good governance seem to have seen less progress as a result of the deterioration in democracy in the countries of the Black Sea and the war between Russia and Georgia in 2008 .
P: What is more , the region is still facing the following problems : chronic conflicts , tendency towards militarisation and the proliferation of weapons , surveillance at sea , trafficking and cross-border crime .
P: I believe that in order to ensure effective implementation , it is necessary to develop regular reports , monitoring , evaluation and monitoring mechanisms .
P: Moreover , the main objectives of the Black Sea strategy should be the construction of an area of peace , stability and prosperity in the Black Sea region and the security of the EU 's energy supply .
P: Therefore , security , good governance , energy , transport , the environment , socio-economic and human development must be given priority actions .
P: I voted in favour of the Ungureanu report because I firmly believe that the EU must urgently develop a more coherent and visible strategy in the Black Sea region .
P: This strategy must be closely linked to the European neighbourhood policy , the development of which has received major impetus through the EU Presidency during the first half of 2009 .
P: The key priority of the EU strategy for the Black Sea must be to ensure the EU 's energy supply and related support for energy projects which are of the interest of the EU and which aim at diversification of gas supply to the EU .
P: The establishment of the Euronest Parliamentary Assembly is also important and urgent for the EU 's energy security .
P: Among the projects whose fulfilment should be promoted by the Black Sea strategy , I see the Nabucco project , the South Stream project , the plan for transporting natural gas ( LNGG ) to Europe , the construction of terminal LNGGGGG into the ports of the Black Sea , as well as that of the pan-European Consentinga - Trieste .
P: The Commission must not dragging on and should conclude , by the end of 2011 , agreements with the potential countries supplying the Nabucco gas pipeline .
P: The energy package that the Commission must present shortly must focus heavily on the energy investments provided for in the Black Sea region mentioned above .
P: Last but not least , it is necessary to emphasise the considerable potential of the renewable energy sources in the Black Sea region , which could make a major contribution to ensuring a safe energy future at global and EU level .

P: Déclarations écrites ( article 149 )
P: I believe that the entry into force of the EU-Korea Free Trade Agreement will have a positive impact on the European Union 's economy .
P: First of all , it would help to achieve lower customs duties estimated at EUR 1.6 billion per year .
P: We should also see an increase in trade , particularly in the services sector where future growth in trade is estimated at 70 % , as well as in the agricultural sector where , at this particular moment , European Union exports to Korea amount to EUR one billion every year .
P: At the same time , this is an ambitious and innovative agreement .
P: It is the first of a new generation of free trade agreements that contain both a chapter on sustainable development and compliance with labour standards and a monitoring mechanism that involves civil society .
P: The fears about the difficulties that Korean competition could cause to the Union 's more sensitive industries , such as the car industry , are dissipated by the inclusion of the safeguard clause in the agreement .
P: It will serve to impose measures to monitor imports and exports and to evaluate the effects of the agreement on the various sectors .
P: We recognise the importance of multilateral cooperation to promote the proper conservation and management of living marine resources , which are at the heart of this agreement .
P: However , the proposal for a regulation that has been approved contains a provision that we consider unacceptable and that we have sought to change by proposing that a paragraph of Article 28 be deleted .
P: Since this proposal has been rejected by the majority , we have voted against the final proposal for a regulation .
P: It aims to give the Commission the power to adopt delegated acts that could affect an area that is part of the exclusive economic area ( EEE ) of a Member State .
P: This area is called ' The Eratosthenes Seestes ' and is part of the WEE of the Republic of Cyprus .
P: This possibility is an attack on the sovereignty of the Republic of Cyprus , all the more so because this area is politically sensitive , since it is illegally divided by a third country that is a candidate country for accession to the EU .
P: The marine funds in this area include natural resources , as the Republic of Cyprus has the legitimate right to exploit under the UN Convention on the Law of the Sea .
P: In this context , the EU 's mandate should not exceed the issues relating to the common fisheries policy .
P: We have always given the utmost importance to multilateral cooperation on promoting the conservation and proper management of living marine resources , which are at the heart of this agreement .
P: However , the proposal for a regulation that has been approved contains a provision that we consider unacceptable and that we have sought to change by proposing the removal of a paragraph of Article 28 .
P: Since this proposal has been rejected by the majority , we have voted against the final proposal for a regulation .
P: The sovereignty of the Republic of Cyprus is called into question , especially as this area is politically sensitive , since it is illegally divided by a third country applying for accession to the EU .
P: The marine funds in this area include natural resources , as the Republic of Cyprus has the legitimate right to exploit under the UN Convention on the Law of the Sea .
P: In this context , the EU 's mandate should not exceed the issues relating to the common fisheries policy .
P: I endorsed this document because the main tasks of the General Fisheries Commission for the Mediterranean ( GFCM ) are to promote development , conservation , rational management and optimal use of marine resources resources , design and recommend conservation measures and promote cooperation projects in the field of training .
P: The proposal for a regulation before us is simply intended to transpose the recommendations adopted by the GFCM and which are already in operation for the GFCM parties into a single piece of legislation .
P: This would be an important step towards simplification , as the European Community has so far adopted annual regulations to adapt and update the existing rules .
P: The proposal presents a series of intelligent solutions .
P: For example , with regard to gear , the proposal for a regulation specifies in detail the minimum structure to be used in the Mediterranean Sea ( Article 15 ) and the Black Sea ( article 16 ) and prohibits the use of trawls and trawls across 1 000 metres of depth ( article 17 ) .
P: It also addresses issues relating to vessels engaged in illegal , unreported and unregulated ( INN ) fishing , etc .
P: par écrit . - ( EN ) J' ai voté en faveur du rapport sur la Commission générale de la pêche pour la Méditerranée ( CFCM ) accord de zone euro .
P: La présente proposition de règlement vise simplement à transposer différentes recommandations adoptées par la CFCM , et déjà en vigueur dans les États contractants de la CFCM , en un acte législatif communautaire unique dans lequel les futures recommandations peuvent être approuvées par le biais d' amendements à cet acte .
P: Cela marquera une étape importante vers la simplification , étant donné que jusqu' à présent la Communauté européenne n' a adopté que des réglementations annuelles visant à adapter et à mettre à jour les règles existantes .
P: This proposal for a regulation is a key moment of accession to the European Union of the General Fisheries Commission for the Mediterranean ( GFCM ) .
P: It is , in fact , extremely interesting by ensuring the transposition of recommendations adopted by the GFCM by a single EU legislative act .
P: This act is certainly a more stable legal instrument than the current instrument and only allows for the addition of future recommendations with changes in the law itself .
P: It is an important step towards improving legal certainty and a contribution towards simplifying the regulations .
P: Apart from the relevance of the provisions on the minimum regulatory structure of fishing nets , Article 28 of this proposal for a regulation also challenges Parliament 's powers .
P: In fact , it states that the provisions in the regulation can be changed within the framework of the ' comitology procedure ' , with the Commission being assisted by management committees presided over by representatives of the Member States .
P: This is an effective privatisation of Parliament 's powers , and it therefore seems desirable for the Commission to work with delegated acts , with the possibility for Parliament or the Council to withdraw delegated powers .
P: At a time when we still feel fully in our European societies the social consequences of the economic and financial crisis , it was important to vote today in favour of the E. Estrela report on reducing health inequalities .
P: Indeed , this report reminds us that inequalities affect both health benefits and that it is important to act on the fundamental causes of these inequalities , so that all European citizens can finally benefit from their fundamental social rights .
P: Citizens are not equal , whether in terms of life expectancy , poverty , social exclusion , and they are not all at risk to health risks .
P: The report also mentions undocumented migrants , who often find it very difficult to benefit from health benefits in host countries .
P: In this way , we call on the Member States to improve access to health care for all , whether they be citizens or not , and to call on them to better coordinate their national health policies .
P: Access to high-quality healthcare is indeed one of the most fundamental rights and should therefore be a priority both for the Union and for the Member States , which remain competent in this area .
P: There are significant inequalities in health and measures to combat these inequalities vary equally greatly in the Member States .
P: As I believe that these differences in health can have a considerable influence on people throughout their lives , they represent a problem that must be tackled with determination and with an innovative political vision .
P: This report contains very interesting solutions to recognise the specific right to the health of citizens , in particular , focusing on both the training of the population and on the coverage of health services .
P: The social consequences of the recent economic and financial crisis are obvious : from the start of the crisis , the number of unemployed has increased by 5 million , many households have been affected by the recession and are now more at risk of poverty or of excessive debt .
P: I believe that it is essential that the reduction of these inequalities should be seen as a priority at all levels of decision-making .
P: I also call on the Commission to give them greater importance in the Europe 2020 strategy and to ensure that the objective of reducing health inequalities is fully taken into account in future initiatives .
P: I voted in favour of this report because health inequalities constitute a problem that must be addressed urgently .
P: They begin early in life and not only persist in old age but also pass on to the following generations .
P: People who , over the first few years of their existence , have been victims of inequalities in access to education , employment and healthcare , as well as inequalities based on gender and the cultural environment , are at risk of having harmful consequences for their health throughout their lives .
P: Moreover , poverty and social exclusion have important consequences for the state of health .
P: The reasons for these health inequalities are , in many cases , unfair and can be avoided .
P: In order to combat health inequalities , specific measures must be taken , particularly with regard to the most vulnerable groups .
P: It is essential that the reduction in health inequalities should be seen as an essential priority , thus guaranteeing effective impact assessments in the field of health .
P: The crisis has hit health care services hard in several Member States of the European Union , both in terms of supply and demand .
P: With regard to supply , the economic and financial crisis has led to a reduction in the level of funds allocated to public health and health services , and also long-term care as a result of budget cuts and lower tax revenue .
P: Moreover , the demand for long-term care services has also increased due to a combination of factors contributing to the deterioration in the state of health of the entire population .
P: Several Member States have included measures in their recovery plans to mitigate the impact of the economic crisis on health services by means of investment in health infrastructure and optimisation of the funding allocated to health services , as well as restructuring and reorganisation of the healthcare system .
P: However , the measures adopted to combat inequalities vary greatly between Member States .
P: The question of access is fundamental in all public services .
P: The collection and exchange of effective strategies , policies and actions will help to obtain support at administrative level and within the various sectors .
P: I agree with the rapporteur , Mrs Estrela , when she says that there are huge health inequalities both between people living in different regions of the European Union and among the most favoured and disadvantaged population groups .
P: These inequalities are tending to start at birth and persist in old age , they are influenced throughout life through access to education , employment and healthcare , and they can be exacerbated by gender and race .
P: It is essential to reduce the scale of the existing inequalities , which compromise the commitments made by the European Union in terms of solidarity , social and economic cohesion , human rights and equal opportunities , making this one of the priority actions of the European Union 's health strategy for the period 2008-2013 .
P: However , it is important to recognise that health policy falls within the competence of the Member States , as well as the establishment of respective systems to enable people to access healthcare .
P: The report describes several interesting measures , but does not consider their financial impact .
P: Nor am I satisfied with the introduction of the abortion issue , which is part of a national and non-European mandate .

P: In fact , when refugees cross a border , they should not be persecuted or received with distrust .
P: I therefore welcome the adoption of this proposal , which has put an end to an interpretation of this problem by acknowledging that the right to asylum is a fundamental right and must be treated in a fair and fair way by the Member States .
P: I welcome the rapporteur 's proposals to establish a system of legal assistance , given that the persons concerned are vulnerable people , who do not have effective safeguards ; to improve procedures ; and to give more rights to asylum seekers , especially minors .
P: The report on the proposal for a directive on minimum standards for the procedure for granting and withdrawing international protection follows the same lines as the creation of a common European asylum system .
P: Nevertheless , it must be understood that the progress of this ' harmonisation ' goes hand in hand with the overall foreign policy followed by the European Union , and its hypocritical positions on immigration and help to refugees .
P: The situation in Lampedusa , where the refugees without adequate protection are concerned by thousands , is a very clear illustration of this , without mentioning the hundreds or thousands of people who have died in boats through the Mediterranean , as has happened , unfortunately .
P: We are extremely concerned about the extent of the current problem , particularly in view of what is happening in serious armed conflicts , in Libya in particular .
P: We also want to point out that this proposal for a directive includes aspects that will end up restricting the right of asylum and applying conditions , particularly by limiting the sovereign right of each Member State to make its own choices and to decide on its asylum procedures .
